pullRequest.body:
Removes some API from the file `Adjunction.Unique` which was a duplicate of API from `Adjunction.Mates`

Co-authored-by: @emilyriehl 

---

- [x] depends on: #17108 

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/6468d908-f673-4ba7-b99d-a906d9e4a2e9) for commit 8c24b1cf945fadbc766a75be45286e21a50952f5.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/e62739b8-b655-4d46-a953-0cfd48f49df5/to/6468d908-f673-4ba7-b99d-a906d9e4a2e9) against commit 6d0638698bd9e481c26abc2827b7d7a53ebbc115:
```diff
  Benchmark                                   Metric         Change
  =================================================================
+ ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Adjunction.Unique   instructions   -62.9%
```

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17108~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11216644518/job/31176389852)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11216644518/job/31176390230)

I think the cause of the duplication in the first place was poor documentation somewhere - in particular it wasn't clear enough that these definitions already existed (and there's a good chance that's my fault!). Do you have an idea where we should add cross-references to ensure others can't make the same mistake you did?

The way this happened was that previously, uniqueness of adjoints lived in the file `Adjunction.Opposites` and was a different construction. I felt that this was a more natural construction and changed it, creating the file `Adjunction.Unique`, without knowing about the material in `Adjunction.Mates`.

I guess it might help to have some signposting in the module docstring `Adjunction.Basic`. Currently, the docstring of the definition of `Adjunction` points to the file `Adjunction.Unique`Â for uniqueness of adjoints (I guess that's because previously it pointed to `Adjunction.Opposites`, which is hard to guess. But we might want more like that in `Adjunction.Basic`

I've added some documentation to `Adjunction.Basic`. It's basically saying one line about what's in each file in the `Adjunction` directory, and feels a bit obvious at times. What do you think @b-mehta?
It looks excellent! Thanks for adding this.
Do you think it's worth deprecating these (in favour of the conjugateIso ones) first, rather than straight-up deleting them first?
They have only existed for a few months, so I think it's fairly unlikely that they are being used outside mathlib. But I'm happy with whatever

I've added aliases for the `Equiv`s `natTransEquiv`Â and `natIsoEquiv`. They don't match `conjugateEquiv`Â and `conjugateIsoEquiv` exactly (they go in the other direction), so I didn't add any for the surrounding lemmas. This is probably enough.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(CategoryTheory/Adjunction): deduplicate API for uniqueness of adjoints
